page.title: 04NATIONAL TRUST-WITLEY COMMON
page.content: In 1921{Witley Common }was bought by the National Trust and today there is a very interesting Nature Information Centre there.The National Trust built the Centre in order to give pleasure and to encourage interest in Nature Conservation and supply the need for countryside management. The Common has a wide range of habitats,animals and plants.There are three marked trails,yellow,orange and red and a team of experienced guides to show people around . Inside the Centre,which is a very attractive,modern building,there is an exhibition of the history of the Common and a ten minute slide show. Upstairs are two rooms ,one for lectures and one for private study. The Centre is open daily from 11.00- 13.00hrs,14.00-17.00hrs,April-October. There is a car park and picnic area.
